org.locationtech.geowave.core.store.query.filter.expression

Class FilterConstraints<V extends Comparable<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.locationtech.geowave.core.store.query.filter.expression.FilterConstraints<V>

  • public class FilterConstraints<V extends Comparable<V>>
extends Object
    Provides constraints for an adapter/index based on a GeoWave filter expression.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getFieldConstraints

        public IndexFieldConstraints<?> getFieldConstraints(String fieldName)
        Get the constraints for the given field.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field to get constraints for
        Returns:
        the field constraints, or null if there weren't any

      • getFieldCount

        public int getFieldCount()
        Returns:
        the number of constrained fields

      • constrainsAllFields

        public boolean constrainsAllFields(Set<String> fields)
        Determines whether or not all of the provided fields are constrained.
        Parameters:
        fields - the fields to check
        Returns:
        true if all of the fields are constrained

      • getExactConstrainedFields

        public Set<String> getExactConstrainedFields()
        Returns:
        a set of fields that are exactly constrained, i.e. the ranges represent the predicate exactly

      • getIndexData

        public List<MultiDimensionalIndexData<V>> getIndexData()
        Get the multi-dimensional index data from these constraints.
        Returns:
        the multi-dimensional index data

      • or

        public void or(FilterConstraints<V> other)
        Combine these constraints with another set of constraints using the OR operator.
        Parameters:
        other - the constraints to combine

      • and

        public void and(FilterConstraints<V> other)
        Combine these constraints with another set of constraints using the AND operator.
        Parameters:
        other - the constraints to combine

      • invert

        public void invert()
        Get the inverse of these constraints. Only 1-dimensional field constraints can be accurately inverted, anything else will result in no constraints.

      • getQueryRanges

        public QueryRanges getQueryRanges(BaseQueryOptions baseOptions,
                                  DataStatisticsStore statisticsStore)
        Get the raw query ranges represented by this filter's index data.
        Parameters:
        baseOptions - the base query options
        statisticsStore - the data statistics store
        Returns:
        the query ranges

      • of

        public static <V extends Comparable<V>> FilterConstraints<V> of(DataTypeAdapter<?> adapter,
                                                                AdapterToIndexMapping indexMapping,
                                                                Index index,
                                                                String fieldName,
                                                                IndexFieldConstraints<V> constraints)
        Create a filter constraint for a single field.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the constraint class
        Parameters:
        adapter - the data type adapter
        indexMapping - the adapter to index mapping
        index - the index
        fieldName - the name of the constrained field
        constraints - the field constraints for the field
        Returns:
        the constructed filter constraints

      • empty

        public static <V extends Comparable<V>> FilterConstraints<V> empty()
        Create a set of empty filter constraints. Empty filter constraints result in a full table scan.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the constraint class
        Returns:
        a set of empty filter constraints
